Search / Goto Basic Usage

The search / goto tool has 3 distinct use cases:

  • Discover Data: Click on the button to the left of the search bar to search for layers that have data for the current visible area and time (if available).
  • Search: Enter a search term into the search bar and press Enter to perform a keyword search.
  • Goto: Enter position information in the form of decimal, degrees-minutes-seconds, and MGRS formats, to go to the location on the map.

Search / Goto Options:

  • Search in View: This option is OFF by default. Servers that provide this capability will allow searches within the current view which is an easy way to limit search results. There is a geographic area limitation of 200,000 square miles associated with this function. If the geographic area of the current view is greater than the limit and a search is performed, there may be no results.
  • Force Text Search: This option is OFF by default. This option will force the 'Search' mode. If a geographic position is entered while using this mode, the position will be used as the search string instead of repositioning on that postion.
  • Search Types: Individual search providers may be selected and deselected prior to searching.
